title: Study Rooms
description: Quiet rooms with Wi-Fi and whiteboards for group or solo study.
rulesResource:
Study rooms are available by reservation only through the online booking system.
Rooms are intended for academic use only such as studying, group projects, tutoring, or meetings related to coursework.
Rooms must be occupied by a minimum of 2 students at all times.
If a group is more than 15 minutes late, the room may be released to other students waiting.

title: Engineering Labs
description: Equipped for mechanical, electrical, and computer experiments.
rulesResource:
Food and drinks are strictly prohibited inside labs.
Technical issues or damaged equipment must be reported immediately to the lab technician or supervisor.
Eligibility: Only registered engineering students, teaching assistants, and faculty are permitted to book lab spaces
Your request will remain pending until an administrator confirms it.
External users must obtain written authorization from the department.

title: Art Studios
description: Spaces for painting, sculpting, and creative projects.
rulesResource:
Eligibility: Rooms are available to all Fine Arts students, faculty, and staff.
Duration: Bookings are for a maximum of 1 hour per session.
Advance Booking: Rooms can be reserved up to 7 days in advance. Walk-ins not available.
Your request will remain pending until an administrator confirms it.
Storage: Projects left behind will be removed after 24 hours unless labeled with your name and date.

title: Film Equipment
description: Cameras, lighting, and sound kits for film and media projects.
rulesResource:
Equipment: You must present your student ID card to pick up equipment.
All equipment must be returned at most one week after it was borrowed.
Repeated no-shows or late returns may result in suspension of booking privileges.
Inspect all equipment at pickup. Report any damage or missing parts immediately.
The student who books the gear is fully responsible for its care, use, and return.
The school reserves the right to charge the borrower's student account for the value of any damaged equipment.

title: Conference Rooms
description: Professional spaces for meetings, presentations, and workshops.
rulesResource:
Conference rooms: Rooms are for meetings, group discussions, and presentations. Not for personal or unrelated activities.
Leave the room clean and tidy after use. Erase whiteboards, remove trash, and reset chairs and tables.
Personal devices may be connected to displays only through approved ports or adapter.
If you no longer need the room, cancel your booking promptly so others can use it.
Arrive on time and do not exceed your reserved time slot.
